intro: Daucus guttatus subsp. zahariadii, commonly known as the Zaharadii horned fennel, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Bulgaria. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves and yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
